channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [LOG4J2-492] MalformedObjectNameException: Invalid escape sequence... under Jetty
item.description:
Although it is not stopping my webapp from running, I am encountering the following exception when running jetty (via Maven) for a webapp using a trunk build of log4j2.

My debug line is also included:

loggerContext.getName()= WebAppClassLoader=1320771902@4eb9613e
2014-01-09 13:28:52,904 ERROR Could not register mbeans java.lang.IllegalStateException: javax.management.MalformedObjectNameException: Invalid escape sequence '\=' in quoted value

item.summary: MalformedObjectNameException: Invalid escape sequence... under Jetty

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Sorry, I should say, I am not confident that this is definitely a log4j2 problem only. I don't understand the JMX enough to know if jetty using that form of context name is an issue.
Thanks for reporting this. The JMX code in log4j2 makes an effort to quote values with special characters but apparently this is not sufficient. I'll take another look.

Fixed in revision 1557307.
Please verify and close.

Remko, the error persist on Tomcat 7;0.35 as bellow described with "\n" !!! Please let'me know if you want any help to fix !

014-01-13 14:27:36,493 DEBUG Calling createLoggers on class org.apache.logging.log4j.core.config.plugins.LoggersPlugin for element loggers with params(Loggers=

{org.springframework.security, org.springframework, org.springframework.web, org.springframework.cache, com.google.code.ssm, net.spy.memcached, net.rubyeye.xmemcached, root}

)

Herlani, thanks for pointing this out!
I've made the necessary changes.
Committed in revisions 1557869, 1557871 and 1557873.
Please verify and close.

Remko HI,

Unfortunately the errors persists. The error still in unregister calls !

I´d fixed the Server.java class changing the block of (\r and \n) in escape method to

case '\r':
// replace by
r, no need to quote
//sb.append("
r");
continue;
case '\n':
// replace by
n, no need to quote
//sb.append("
n");
continue;

And also I´d changed the registerContexts method adding a call to escape method with context name ! (unregisterContext( escape(ctx.getName()))

Please check attached file !!

Thanks,

HJR
Remko, what's the status on this? I see that it has gone back and forth a few times.

I reopened this yesterday afternoon as I still need to do work on this.

Herlani has identified that the context name also needs to be escaped when creating an ObjectName to unregister a context.

Herlani, you also propose to drop '\r' and '\n' characters from the ObjectName values, I am not sure if that is the right thing to do. My original code replaces '\r' and '\n' characters with backslash backslash r and backslash backslash n sequences, respectively. My unit tests pass without throwing MalformedObjectException... Why is this necessary? Is this causing an error or other issue? (Ideally one that I can reproduce?)

Update: re-checked the spec and values with backslashes should be quoted, so after turning a '\n' character into a backslash backslash n sequence, the value should be quoted; I wasn't doing that correctly. Unless there is some other problem I would rather not drop these characters...

I've made a change to escape the context name before unregistering the LoggerContext. I decided to drop the \r characters but convert \n to backslash backslash n and quote the value. ({{backslash backslash r characters in quoted values resulted in "invalid escape sequence").

Fixed in revision 1562419.
Please verify and close.

Hi Remko, sorry about late reply. Confirming that current trunk release is working fine !

Shaddy Baddah you can close the issue !
Closing the issue as the fix is confirmed. Please feel free to reopen if you encounter any problems.
